Package com.example.ss7g7.stars

Class StarsDB

java.lang.Object
com.example.ss7g7.stars.StarsDB
public class StarsDB
extends java.lang.Object

Stars Database System

The StarsDB is a singleton that acts as a 'database' Since we are not allowed to use any databases, this class helps us manage the students and courses.

The StarsDB is used to store the data throughout the application. The initial data is loaded through file IO from text files.

Since:
2020/10/15
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ong Rui Peng, Kah Hui, Angelina

    • init

      public boolean init​(java.lang.String studentDataFilePath, java.lang.String courseDataFilePath)
      Loads data from the files using the file paths given. Creates dummy students/courses if none was loaded from the files.
      Parameters:
      studentDataFilePath - refers to the .ser data file of the students
      courseDataFilePath - refers to the .ser data file of the courses
      Returns:
      true returns upon initialization of the database

      Returns:

    • getStudent

      public Student getStudent​(java.lang.String userName)
      This method retrieves a student based on a username, searches through the students data in the database linearly and returns the first result which corresponds to the student's username.
      Parameters:
      userName -
      Returns:
      student if student is found in database; null if student is not found.

      Returns:
      s if student is found in the database; null if student is not found.

    • getValidDateTime

      public java.util.Calendar getValidDateTime​(java.lang.String mode) throws java.text.ParseException
      This method validates user input for the start and end access date.
      Parameters:
      mode - can be the start or end of the access date
      Returns:
      newDate is a user input date that is correctly formatted
      Throws:
      java.text.ParseException - when the user inputted start or end access date is incorrectly formatted.

      public Course getCourseByIndex​(int indexNo)

      Parameters:
      indexNo -
      Returns:
      course if course with given index is found; null if course is not found.

    • removeCourse

      public void removeCourse​(java.lang.String courseCode)
      Removes a course from the database with the corresponding course code, does not remove if course does not exist in the DB. Once course is removed, students that are registered to the course will also be removed.
      Parameters:
      courseCode - refers to the course to be removed

    • updateCourseRecords

      public void updateCourseRecords​(Course course, int indexToRemove)
      This method updates the course records stored in the .ser file. When index of course is deleted, students registered to the index will also be removed.
      Parameters:
      course - refers to the course to be updated
      indexToRemove -

      oldIndex -
      newIndex -
